basics.name: Santiago Espinosa Mooser
basics.summary:
Hey there! My name is Santiago. I'm currently a Computer Science student at the University of Hong Kong. If you are reading this, I'm probably looking for a job. This page serves as a quick introduction to my professional life and my personal projects that might be relevant to the job I'm applying to.
If you would like to interview me or simnply connect with me to collaborate on any projects, feel free to email me using the email address on the right.

work.name: Hex Trust
work.description: Hex Trust is a digital asset custody firm.
work.summary: Worked to improve company's cybersecurity posture.
highlights: Worked with CISO, Head of Platform and Head of Cybersecurity to propose and implement first-ever DevSecOps pipeline in the company by gathering information about the industry-standard tools and proposing said pipeline to developers before implementing it on production.
Worked with  for company laptops through the use of bash scripting to reduce provisioning time of Ubuntu-based computers from 2-3 hours to 5-10 minutes.
Worked with the head of Cybersecurity to monitor and respond to alerts on the company's SIEM and WAF systems through the use of Elastic Query Language and Wazuh.

work.name: Handshake Networking
work.description: Handshake Networking is cybersecurity consultancy company.
work.summary: Worked in various positions, eventually working to develop a fully-featured Django-based API.
highlights: Single-handedly designed, developed and deployed python-based Django backend API used to automatically scan vessels using nmap with the use of remote scanners that communicated using RabbitMQ queues and asynchronous celeray tasks.
Developed and deployed full (but simple) DevSecOps pipeline and unit tests for the API project to speed up the development process of the API.
Installed, managed and maintained XCP-ng hypervisor server to enable the deployment and use of Ubuntu-based VMs internally within the company.
Assisted in the ASV exam recertification by scripting and automating reconnaissance and reporting stages.
Deployed various docker-based services for internal use such as Bookstack (and internal wiki), GitLab and an Ubuntu-based Samba server.
Scripted and set up automated backup from XCP-ng server to tapes using Bash scripting.
Developed tools & web applications for internal use such as an ike-scan & nmap multithreaded wrapper (see github)

work.name: PricewaterhouseCoopers New Ventures
work.description: PWC New Ventures builds software solutions for PWC's client base.
highlights: Worked with the head of DevOps to automate server deployments and provisionings using Ansible and Terraform. This reduced deployment and privisioning time from 3-5 business days to 30-45 minutes.
Wrote and maintained Ansible-based playbook to deploy internal communication tools instance (Mattermost). This deployment used docker-compose and Bash.
Troubleshooted certificate issues on docker-based deployments through the use of tools such as docker-compose, lazydocker and certbot.

courses: COMP3250 - Design And Analysis of Algorithms
highlights: Marketing Secretary (2021-2022, 2022-2023) for the Computer Science Association
Lead organizer for the HKU Computer Science Society's Virtual Career Week 2022.
Director of Internal Communications (2019-2020) of HKUâ€™s feminist group HeForSheForUs

skills.name: Linux systems
skills.description: Daily-drive Arch Linux on my main PC as well as my work Laptop. Comfortable creating services, automating weekly maintenance, and managing software.

skills.name: DevOps & SRE
skills.description:
- Worked on DevOps and Site Reliability Engineering projects, as well as developed my own dockerfiles, docker-compose setups and Ansible playbooks.
- Developed and deployed Docker containers for various projects, including academic, work and personal projects.

skills.name: App Self-Hosting
skills.description: - Self-host multiple services at home which I regularly use.

projects.name: Haskell-based interpreter
projects.description: Developed a Haskell-based interpreter for a custom programming language as the final project for the Principles of Programming Languages Course.

projects.name: Computer Science Association Virtual Career Week 2022
projects.description: Organized and spearheaded the 2022 virtual career week event for the Computer Science Association. Involved six speakers from various companies topics, including: Site Reliability Engineer, IT Governance Risk and Compliance, and Software Engineering. Also served as host for three different fireside talks.

projects.name: Unraid Self-hosted Media Server
projects.description: Deployment and Maintenance of Home Media server as well as backup of personal data

projects.name: Complete off-site and offline backup of all personal devices
projects.description: Set up a warm backup system for all personal devices to two separate cloud providers through the use of CGNAT VPN, syncthing and ZFS.

references.reference: Santiago was always willing to offer his assistance and had excellent technical skills on working software products.
